param_note.para: The value current system interrupt priority is lowered to. The value has to be between IPL1 and IPL31 inclusive, or IPL_Base.

return.para: If specified interrupt priority is lower than current system interrupt priority, the original system interrupt priority will be returned. If specified interrupt priority is not less than current system interrupt priority, the current system interrupt priority is returned.

remarks.para: If specified interrupt priority is lower than current system interrupt priority, this method lowers the current system interrupt priority to specified interrupt priority, and returns the original system interrupt priority. If the specified interrupt priority is not less than current system interrupt priority, this method only returns current system interrupt priority.

Lowering current system interrupt priority will cause all hardware interrupts with a higher interrupt priority than the specified priority, to respond. If the current system interrupt priority is lowered to IPL_Base, then all hardware interrupts are allowed to respond.
